intro: Hauya standleyi, commonly known as the Sierra Leone hauya, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It has elliptical leaves with a rough texture and is typically shrub-like in growth habit. Hauya standleyi is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
